reviewText: i also bought the bellydance dvd by Kathy Smith, but by far i loved this one by Neon (i really thought this was going to be more of a silly 'gimick', basing on her unusual name 'Neon', but it turns out she really knows her stuff!)she takes you thru many basic moves, w/an overlying grid to show you precisely how to do it, and is taught an easy but not TOO slow of a pace either lol. i have both her 1 and 2 dvd, and i'm now ordering her "Dance Today! Bellydance - Active Lifestyle Makeover" dvd (for fun and to test out my  newest skills).this one's a real bargin for the price! :)
summary: Clearly explans all the moves, pleasant voice to listen to, A GREAT TEACHER NEON IS!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Be prepared to spend more than one session learning this DVD set, because although it is fast-paced, there are more than three hours of instruction.This DVD is more for the dancer who wants to expand her steps or hone her technique than it is for a beginner, but a beginner could learn by being patient and repeating the segments. The DVD includes illustrative graphics of the moves which I would prefer to be left out, but they might be useful to a beginner.I hesitated to purchase this because I wasn't sure if it was a repackaged version of Neon's other Instant Belly Dancer DVDs, but it is, in fact, a stand-alone program, similar in content, but with a new format.I actually liked the format of this better than Neon's other Instant Belly Dancer DVD set. It seems a bit more professional, if you discount the strange background with changing images. (Note: If you're going to include images in a false landscape with geometric shapes behind the instructor, at least have a similar theme throughout. Don't jump back and forth from garden scenes to cityscapes unless you really want to hamper the effectiveness of the DVD.)The best thing about this DVD set, in my opinion, is that nearly all of the time the camera is on Neon so you can clearly see what she is doing. Also, I appreciate the fact that Neon goes over the moves clearly and wears  costumes that make it easy to see the legwork. Nothing's more frustrating than trying to learn new moves while the camera is off elsewhere or the instructor is unfocused and/or badly dressed.I think most students of belly dance will like Neon's pleasant, professional style. She is a pleasure to learn from.

reviewText: Neon is always good to me. Love her work. This was just another good add to my collection.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I highly recommend this to all of my students. Neon teaches what a friend called "generic bellydance."  It translates well into Egyptian, Cabaret, and Turkish in terms of teaching the basics needed to progress in dance.  The moves are chaptered nicely, and the trajectories drawn on the side of the screen clearly illustrate the direction the hips are moving-if it is a lift to the front, if it is a drop, if it is a slide, etc.Neon's personality and accent are pleasant, the graphics are non-interruptive, and she is a beautiful dancer (although I wish there had been a performance section).What I really like are the practice sessions, where combinations of the taught moves are put together into a series.  The practice sessions alone are a good workout and a great review.  The length of the instructional session is also very good--good enough where you have to stop it and digest it in bites.  There are a variety of ribcage slides and isolations, hip slides, bumps, and circles, hip lifts, hip lifts with directions (i.e. front side back), traveling steps using hip lifts and bumps, etc.  Her traveling step combinations are innovative yet classic, and not what one sees in every performance. Most moves can also be done to a 4/4 count, so it makes it ideal for practicing to both classical and modern BD music.It's a great value for the money, and for those of us who teach, truly enforces a good foundation in our students.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow!!! Get this one for sure! Here are over three hours of instruction that will prepare you and place you well on your way! This instructional program has previously released separately; today it is offered in a two part set.Part one of "Instant Belly Dancer"The program begins delightfully; add water to a beautiful demi- tasse, and stir, voila! Neon appears to guide you into the enchanting world of belly dance.If you are new to belly dance, this program is a great way to begin. If you have been here awhile you will consider this program a priceless guide which organizes movement, body placement and terminology.Those of us who have trained extensively and moved from varied instruction have experienced much of the dance jargon, dance theory, etc. that goes with each teacher's different approach to the same trajectory. A universal belly dance terminology illustrated in geometric patterns can simplify teaching and help the student make the transition from "hand me down" terms which vary from instructor to instructor, and will keep integrity in the dance terminology as well as create a visual tool.The first program is divided into the following:Upper and lower bodyHorizontal and vertical circles,Horizontal and vertical semi circles,Horizontal and vertical infinity loops,Head movementsTwo practice sessions to allow you try out your newly acquired dance moves. There are 6 reviews to guide you through each segment with traveling steps, arm and hand embellishments, and numerous combinations which allow you to create your dance. Precision and fluidity are a sure gain as Neon perfectly illustrates each move, with the neatest backdrop of cityscapes as she pops out of a third dimensional animated creation of a mock dance floorThe second set continues with these and more:Upper and lower body slidesIsolating the hips) lifts and dropsPelvic drops and locksHip twistsChest lift and dropArcsUpward front to backDownward Back to frontLearn Arabic hip walk, up and down hip shimmy, twist shimmy, much more!Review sections are also included in the second dvd*Points to consider, this is a fast paced learning program which contains endless detail and priceless information along with great practice sections. Great detailed instruction!
summary: So.....you want to learn to belly dance?

reviewText: I love the way the computer graphics were used to show how a move relates to the body.  This will be very helpful to visual learners.  One of the great things about DVDs is that you can pause, back up, and repeat anything that you need to repeat.  I will recommend this set to students because they can easily access the basics that they need more practice doing.  It will give them a DVD list, of sorts, to practice.
summary: I enjoyed these and will recommend
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have seen at least one review of this DVD set that claims it's not beginner level and was too difficult. If you are totally new to belly dance, if you are NOT taking lessons, then, that might indeed be the case.If you ARE already taking lessons, and having a hard time getting your isolations "down", then this DVD set may be helpful. If your ARE already taking lessons, and not having a hard time with anything much, then this DVD set may NOT for you.The good points of this DVD set are the "animations", little drawings of what should be moving, and in what direction, and on what "plane" (horizontal, vertical, forward, back.... etc.) These can be VERY helpful if you are having a hard time with this kind of circle, or that kind of figure 8 (which Neon calls "infinity loops".)I bought this set when I first started taking lessons. I have a VERY good teacher, so, there were no surprises from the DVDs, or really anything that I could not already do, or that we were not already working on in class. I used it to help me make some things "better", but got really quite bored with it very quickly. That's the down side of this set, from my perspective.Bottom line: If you are already taking lessons this may not be a DVD set for you. If you are having a hard time with the basic moves, this DVD set might help. If you are trying to learn to belly dance on your own, you SHOULD get this DVD set.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was very disappointed with this DVD.  Neon does not teach well, she doesn't break things down enough before taking it to full speed.  She also wears high heels which seems a little unusual to me as a belly dancer and it makes it hard to see her foot work.  She doesn't explain her movements that well and it's hard to follow.  She also throws her own little moves into it before teaching you the basics so it's hard to follow her.  I am a dancer and I learn pretty quickly, I've been belly dancing for about 5 months now and I know basics, but even though this is targeted towards beginners it's more advanced, people who can pick it up immediately and do it to perfection without much instruction.  She throws in extra moves that she likes without telling you, I guess it's just her style but she is supposed to be teaching "basics" (beginners) and this is not geared towards beginners.  I would never buy another Neon DVD again, just because of the way she teaches, I don't like it.  There are too many others belly dancers out there that are really good at taeching, breaking movements down and drilling them.  I have a good library of belly dancing DVDs already, but I wish I could return this one.  If I can't return it then it goes in the trash.  What a waste of money.
Title: N/A
